title: New Epstein Emails Alleged Trump Knew of His Conduct
summary: In a message obtained by Congress, the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein wrote that Donald J. Trump spent hours at his house with one of Mr. Epstein’s victims.

title: By Not Funding Food Stamps, Trump Risks Lasting Damage to Safety Net
summary: For the poorest Americans, the expected end to the longest shutdown in history has left doubt and anxiety around the benefits known as SNAP.

title: What to Know About SNAP, America’s Main Food Aid Program
summary: The shutdown brought the scale of the federal food aid program into focus and raised questions about how such a rich country could have so many people on nutrition assistance.

title: Atlanta Fed President to Step Down in February
summary: The departure of Raphael W. Bostic, who has served in the role since 2017, would create a new vacancy at the central bank.

title: The I.R.S. Tried to Stop This Tax Dodge. Scott Bessent Used It Anyway.
summary: Like many on Wall Street, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent used a limited partnership to avoid Medicare taxes. Unlike the others, he’s now overseeing the I.R.S.

title: Missing at U.N.’s Climate Meeting: American Executives
summary: Many business leaders are skipping the annual United Nations climate summit in Belém, Brazil, or are attending events in other cities.

title: There’s a New Forecast for Peak Oil Demand. It’s Increasingly Cloudy.
summary: The International Energy Agency once projected that oil and gas demand could level off by 2030. Now it’s backing off, sort of.

title: Blood and Tears as Spain’s Troubled Bullfighting Star Hangs Up His Cape
summary: José Antonio Morante Camacho says he has fought his last bull. Fans appreciated his artistry but also his honesty about his struggles with mental illness.

title: He Died at a School for Disabled People. Decades Later, His Brother Sought Answers.
summary: John Scott was rarely spoken of in his family after he was placed in an institution. After a half-century, his youngest brother set out to learn who he was and what happened to him.

title: Xi’s Military Purges Show Unease About China’s Nuclear Forces
summary: The shake-up in China’s armed forces comes as both Beijing and Washington are pushing through major changes in their country’s militaries, in different ways.

title: Jack Schlossberg, Scion of the Kennedy Family, Gives Politics a Try
summary: As he prepares a congressional run, J.F.K.’s grandson admits, “I’m not for everybody.”

title: Jack Schlossberg, Kennedy Heir, to Seek Nadler’s N.Y. Congressional Seat
summary: Mr. Schlossberg, the son of Caroline Kennedy, said the Democratic Party needed someone who could stand up to President Trump and his allies.

title: Michelle Obama’s New Book Is a Historical Document Dressed Up as a Coffee-Table Tome
summary: “The Look” should be studied by generations to come, not because of what it reveals about fashion, but politics.

title: Pakistan’s Army Chief Is Granted Sweeping Authority Over All Military Branches
summary: A constitutional amendment in the nuclear-armed country extends the chief’s power over all the military and brings Pakistan’s highest court under tighter political control.

title: Deadly Blasts in India and Pakistan Set Region on Edge
summary: The rare explosions in the country’s capitals have not been directly linked, but there are fears the governments will blame each other after their previous military conflict alarmed the world.

title: Israel Reopens Gaza Aid Route It Had Closed for Months
summary: The cease-fire with Hamas has blunted the hunger faced by Gazans during the war. But aid agencies say Israeli restrictions are still hobbling their work.

title: Israel’s president says Trump asked him to pardon Netanyahu, who has not been convicted.
What Are Antidepressants Doing to Teen Sexual Development
summary: Research on adults who take S.S.R.I.s shows they tamp down sexual desire. Why aren’t we studying what that could mean for adolescents who take them?

title: What to Know About Teen Sexual Development and S.S.R.I.s
summary: There is basically no research that looks at the impact of antidepressants on emerging sexuality. Here are the key things we do know.

title: Who Pays When A.I. Is Wrong?
summary: New court cases seek to define content created by artificial intelligence as defamatory — a novel concept that has captivated some legal experts.

title: At the Cybathlon, May the Best Brain-Computer Interface Win
summary: Every four years at the Cybathlon, teams of researchers and technology “pilots” compete to see whose brain-computer interface holds the most promise.

title: Tim Kaine on Why He Voted to End the Government Shutdown
summary: Extending the government shutdown would not have worked.

title: Abortion Has Remained Mostly Accessible. That May Soon Change.
summary: American women need the freedom to determine the course of their own lives.

title: Dale Romans Enters Kentucky Senate Race as Democrats’ Latest Long Shot
summary: Dale Romans, pitching himself as an independent-minded Democrat in the mold of Joe Manchin, will try to win a seat for the party in the deep-red state.

title: Northern Lights Bring Dazzling Views to Northeast U.S. and Across Canada, With More Possible Tonight
summary: After a colorful display overnight, the northern U.S., parts of Canada and Britain could see the aurora Wednesday night.

title: Scientists Grow More Hopeful About Ending a Global Organ Shortage
summary: At an international conference, researchers at the forefront of animal-human transplantation compared notes and allowed themselves the first real optimism in decades.

title: Kim Kardashian’s Skims Is Worth an Extra Billion Dollars
summary: The apparel giant is now valued at $5 billion after a new fund-raising round, as it continues to grow its business.
